numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Some students are legacy applicants of an elite college.
2. Some students are not legacy applicants of an elite college.
3. A legacy applicant has a higher chance of admission than a non-legacy applicant.
4. Some applicants have parents whose income rank is among the highest overall.
5. An applicant whose parents' income rank is among the highest overall is more likely to be admitted than an applicant whose parents' income rank is not among the highest overall.
6. The Estimated Legacy Boost is much higher for richer legacy applicants than for poorer legacy applicants.
7. We wonder why the Estimated Legacy Boost differs between richer people and poorer people.
8. This topic relates to our community.
9. We are students in a high school.
10. Most students in our high school come from middle-class income families.
11. Some students in our high school could have a chance of admission to an elite college.
12. The distribution of admission rates shows a hidden preference for legacy applicants over non-legacy applicants.
13. The distribution of admission rates also shows a preference for richer families over poorer families.
15. If we apply to an elite college then we should be unsure about our chance of admission.
16. We may not have a legacy boost.
17. The headline is: The Real Reason You Didn't Get Into an Elite College.
18. The headline also is: All They Want is Your Money.
